meanings.definition: The process of supplying nerves to a body part.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the nervations in my hand, ensuring I understood the nerve supply.
meanings.sent2: The nervations in the spinal cord play a crucial role in transmitting signals.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my cat must have extra nervations in its tail, making it twitch so much.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a calming effect on me, like gentle nervations soothing my worries.
meanings.sent5: The intricate network of nervations in the brain is fascinating to study.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of nerves in a leaf or other structure.
meanings.sent1: The botanist marveled at the nervations in the leaf, noting their intricate patterns.
meanings.sent2: The nervations in the tree branch help transport nutrients efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The artist drew exaggerated nervations on the leaf, creating a whimsical design.
meanings.sent4: The city's roads resembled the nervations of a leaf, branching out in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The delicate nervations of the flower petal added to its beauty.
